post.title: Entra September Recap
post.content:
[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”section” _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_color=”#ffffff” custom_padding=”||0px|” custom_padding_tablet=”||0px|” transparent_background=”off” padding_mobile=”on”][et_pb_row custom_padding=”||0px|” padding_mobile=”on” column_padding_mobile=”on” parallax_method_1=”off” admin_label=”row” _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″][et_pb_divider show_divider=”off” disabled_on=”on|on|off” _builder_version=”3.17.1″ height=”110″ hide_on_mobile=”on”][/et_pb_divider][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.0.87″ text_font=”PT Sans|on|||” text_text_color=”#bcbcbc” text_letter_spacing=”2px” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”||0px|” custom_padding=”||0px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”] Entrepeunuer [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.18.7″ text_font=”PT Sans||||” text_text_color=”#1d1d1d” text_font_size=”72″ text_font_size_tablet=”52″ text_font_size_last_edited=”on|desktop” text_line_height=”1.1em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”660px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”18px||80px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”]

Entra September Recap

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_color=”#f7f7f4″ custom_padding=”0|0px|165px||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”0px|||” transparent_background=”off”][et_pb_row custom_padding=”0px|||” padding_mobile=”on” column_padding_mobile=”on” parallax_method_1=”off” parallax_method_2=”off” admin_label=”row” _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” use_custom_width=”on” custom_width_px=”620px”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″][et_pb_image src=”http://entra.local/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/matti-d-6-2015-0137-2-e1539712696364.png” show_bottom_space=”off” align=”center” _builder_version=”3.17.1″ max_width=”22%” max_width_tablet=”17%” max_width_phone=”24%” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” custom_margin=”-48px|||” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” animation=”off” sticky=”on”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.17.1″ text_font=”PT Sans||||” text_text_color=”#323232″ text_font_size=”18″ text_line_height=”1.4em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”14px||0px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”] Justin McIntosh [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.22.7″ text_font=”PT Sans|on|||” text_text_color=”#363636″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”0px|||” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”]

3, October 2019

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row custom_padding=”0px||0||false|false” column_padding_mobile=”on” parallax_method_1=”off” parallax_method_2=”off” admin_label=”row” _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” use_custom_width=”on” custom_width_px=”620px”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.22.7″ text_font=”PT Serif||||” text_text_color=”#363636″ text_font_size=”24″ text_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” text_line_height=”1.4em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” custom_margin=”40px||0px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”]

Thank you for your support in joining us on this incredible journey of introducing Entra to the world! This project means so much to me on so many different levels.

What’s more, as a seasoned serial entrepreneur- I have even successfully sold my businesses in the past, bringing together a group of entrepreneurs from so many different industries, so many different personal and professional motivations and goals couldn’t be a more apt mission for my career.

This is the first blog post of this nature, and I hope to produce one of its kind each month to document the journey of Entra and what we are working on in plenty of great detail. I promise to be as honest with you as possible.

With that being said, here goes nothing…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.22.7″ text_font=”PT Serif||||” text_text_color=”#363636″ text_font_size=”20″ text_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” text_line_height=”1.5em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” custom_margin=”30px||0px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”]

Product

We’re launching production of Entra at the beginning of this month for the beta stage of our business. We targeted our beta program audience to Southern California friends and family.

Overall, we’ve had some great feedback and we cannot wait to get to work on iterating this product.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ custom_padding=”50px|||” custom_padding_tablet=”17px|||” padding_mobile=”on” column_padding_mobile=”on” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|tablet” parallax_method_1=”off” parallax_method_2=”off” _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_width_px=”830px”][et_pb_column type=”3_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″][et_pb_image src=”http://entra.local/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Screen-Shot-2019-10-03-at-10.34.27-AM.jpg” show_bottom_space=”off” _builder_version=”3.22.7″ animation_style=”fade” animation_duration=”500ms” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” animation=”fade_in” sticky=”on”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row custom_padding=”50px|||” padding_mobile=”on” column_padding_mobile=”on” parallax_method_1=”off” _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” use_custom_width=”on” custom_width_px=”620px”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″][et_pb_divider color=”#aeaeac” _builder_version=”3.2″ hide_on_mobile=”off”][/et_pb_divider][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.22.7″ text_font=”PT Serif||||” text_text_color=”#363636″ text_font_size=”20″ text_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” text_line_height=”1.5em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” custom_margin=”30px||0px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”]

Marketing

Throughout the month of September, we have been experimenting heavily with paid advertising, primarily from Facebook and LinkedIn. Our goal was to get 60 signups by the end of September. At the end of the month, we reached 55 signups. This is a good number for the launch of the product, however, I would have liked to see more people sign up. More importantly, we are averaging about 1 question per day. I am going to focus on trying to get this number up via new user flows.

For inbound marketing, I am tracking my experiments in Airtable. I have to say I love this product. It’s very clean and easy to use. It’s also super flexible, which makes it easier to customize for my needs.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ custom_padding=”50px||0||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”17px|||” column_padding_mobile=”on” custom_padding=”17px||35px||false|false” column_padding_mobile=”on” parallax_method_1=”off” parallax_method_2=”off” admin_label=”row” _builder_version=”3.22.3″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” use_custom_width=”on” custom_width_px=”620px”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.22.7″ text_font=”PT Serif||||” text_text_color=”#363636″ text_font_size=”20″ text_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” text_line_height=”1.5em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” max_width=”620px” custom_margin=”30px||0px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid”]

Staff

We’re running Entra as thin as we can since we are bootstrapping the entire project by ourselves. Our current staff is comprised of the following people:

  • 1 Marketing Contractor
  • 1 Full-Time Developer (me)
  • 1 Part-Time Developer
  • 1 Copywriter Contractor

I‘m hoping to scale down the development help after we have made a few adjustments to the current features. After that, I will slowly iterate the product based on the feedback from our community of customers.

As for October, we plan on participating in more speaking engagements and local meetups to spread the word organically. We are also working on a search feature and the ability to sort and fix the pagination. I am also working on a new point system that will be more like a level system rather than a badge system. I have some ideas about this that I cannot share just yet…

October Goals

  • 100 total signups
  • 30 questions asked
  • 15 questions answered

What do you think of Entra so far? Have you asked or answered any questions so far?

What kind of projects are you working on for your business for the month of October? What goals have you outlined to see them to fruition?
